name: Tellurium
educationalNotes: Tellurium is rare metalloid - selenium's heavier cousin! Tellurium dioxide used in optical fibers for telecommunications. Cadmium telluride solar cells are efficient photovoltaics. Tellurium alloys strengthen steel and copper wires. Tellurium compounds have garlic smell - tellurium breath odor lasts weeks! Discovered in 1782. Produced as byproduct of copper/gold mining. High refractive index used in lenses. Brittle crystalline element with metallic luster.

diffusion.usage: Sum atomic contributions for compound Σv, then: D_AB = 0.00143×T^1.75 / (P × M_AB^0.5 × (Σv_A^(1/3) + Σv_B^(1/3))²)
